#Text=Election of new 7 wonders of the world : deadline approaching
#Text=Monday , June 25 , 2007
#Text=The New Open World Foundation will announce the results of the New Seven Wonders of the World election on July 7 , 2007 ( or 07.07.07 ) .
#Text=The ballot itself will close on midnight the day before .
#Text=The Foundation proposes a revision of the ancient Seven Wonders of the World , of which only the Great Pyramid of Giza still exist .

#Text=Among the 21 candidates left over after the previous election round ended on January 1 , 2006 , the Acropolis and the Maya archeological site of Chichen Itza were doing well in earlier rankings .
#Text=A spokeswoman for the Foundation said earlier this month that the result is wide open .
#Text=The election ceremony will be held in Lisbon , Portugal .

#Text=Hollywood actress Hilary Swank , British actor Sir Ben Kingsley and Bollywood actress Bipasha Basu have been announced as hosts , astronaut Neil Armstrong will be present , and performers will include Jennifer Lopez and Chaka Khan .
#Text=Countries promote their monuments
#Text=Some in India fear however that the Taj Mahal might not make the A-list .
#Text=In the Bihar town of Muzaffarpur , sex workers are asking people to cast their vote for the monument in Agra .
#Text=" We are doing it in our own small way to promote the 17th century monument of love , " said prostitute Shahnaj Bano .
#Text=Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan ordered the construction of the mausoleum when his favourite wife died .
#Text=People of all walks of life have joined the campaign in India :
#Text=for example , hundreds of lawyers in Rajkot collectively casted their vote to support the Taj in the world wonder poll .

#Text=India 's Tourism and Culture Minister , Ambika Soni , previously pitched in the campaign by personally voting for the Taj Mahal , but government officials confirmed that they did not officially support the initiative of the for-profit organisation . "

#Text=The campaign is not backed by any government agency , though we feel it is good and in the interest of the tourism industry as a whole to promote the Taj Mahal ,  declared Sudhir Kumar , the Agra chief of the Indian government 's tourism department , to the Indo-Asian News Service .

column1: #Text=The Foundation ' Campaign Milestones page ' however claims that " more than 25 percent of the world 's population is now aware of the N7W campaign " after the media attention around the time the final round began on January 1 , 2006 .
#Text=UNESCO also criticized the project 's lack of scientific foundation , when compared to its own World Heritage Sites selection method .
#Text=The candidates
#Text=Originally the Pyramids of Giza had to compete against the others in the election , but after criticism in Egypt , they were removed from the election list and made an honorary candidate .
#Text=The 20 other candidates are :
#Text=The Acropolis of Athens , Greece .
#Text=The Alhambra in Granada , Spain .
#Text=The temple of Angkor Wat in Cambodia .
#Text=Chichen Itza in Yucatan , Mexico .
#Text=Christ the Redeemer in Rio de Janeiro , Brazil .
#Text=The Colosseum in Rome , Italy .
#Text=The Easter Island Moais on Easter Island , Chile .
#Text=The Eiffel Tower in Paris , France .
#Text=The Great Wall of China .
#Text=The Hagia Sophia in Istanbul , Turkey .
#Text=The Kiyomizu Temple in Kyoto , Japan .
#Text=The Kremlin , Red Square , and Saint Basil 's Cathedral in Moscow , Russia .
#Text=Machu Picchu in Cuzco , Peru .
#Text=Neuschwanstein Castle in Füssen , Germany .
#Text=Petra in Jordan .
#Text=The Statue of Liberty in New York City , United States .
#Text=Stonehenge in Amesbury , United Kingdom .
#Text=Sydney Opera House in Australia .
#Text=The Taj Mahal in Agra , India .
#Text=Timbuktu , Mali .
